Functions

Check that an enum has a valid value
These routines return true (1) if the int passed is a valid value for the enumerated type, and false (0) if it is not. Enum values of the type FC_X_UNKNOWN are considered valid because they are possible values of the enum. In many cases you may want to check for a "good" value and should check "fc_isXValid(value) && value != FC_X_UNKNOWN".

int fc_isVerbosityLevelValid (FC_VerbosityLevel verbosity)
 Verify that the given value is valid for this enum.
int fc_isReturnCodeValid (FC_ReturnCode rc)

 Verify that the given value is valid for this enum.
int fc_isAssociationTypeValid (FC_AssociationType assoc)
 Verify that the given value is valid for this enum.
Get the name of an enum value as text
These routines return a text string holding the name of the enum value. If the enum value is invalid, they return NULL. The returned string should NOT be freed.

char * fc_getVerbosityLevelText (FC_VerbosityLevel verbosity)
 Return the name of the FC_VerbosityLevel's value.
